bullets.text: U.S. regulators set new dollar thresholds for Truth in Lending and Consumer Leasing coverage, changing which credit/lease transactions face disclosure and compliance duties.
Agencies updated the “smaller-loan” exemption threshold for appraisal rules on higher-priced mortgages, affecting origination costs and underwriting for small balances.
Two Fed officials who often disagree both signal inflation risks look contained, reinforcing expectations for easier policy and lower rate volatility.
Customs says tariff collections hit $200B under Trump policy, underscoring a durable, tax-like price wedge on imports and heightened trade friction.
AI-infrastructure stocks sold off (Broadcom, Oracle), signaling investor concern about capex payback, demand durability, and crowded AI supply-chain positioning.
Asia-Pacific equities fell as the U.S.-led AI selloff spilled over, highlighting global sensitivity to megacap tech multiples and AI-exposed cyclicals.
Ford will book ~$19.5B in charges to scale back EV plans, pivoting toward hybrids/range-extenders; signals slower-than-expected mass-market EV adoption.
Ford is launching a battery storage business targeting data centers and grid services, aligning automaker strategy with surging electricity demand from AI compute.
PayPal applied to form a U.S. bank to offer small-business loans and savings, intensifying fintech-bank competition and potential regulatory scrutiny.
Pentagon taking ~10% stake in a new Korea Zinc Tennessee smelter highlights industrial-policy support for strategic metals and efforts to de-risk supply chains.
U.K. intelligence warns Russia is escalating destabilization across Europe, raising security risks and reinforcing long-term defense spending pressure.
Ukraine claims an underwater drone struck a Russian submarine—if confirmed, it’s a major shift in naval risk, port security, and deterrence dynamics.
U.S. officials say Ukraine peace talks are progressing, with claims Russia is open to EU membership—potentially reshaping sanctions outlook and European security architecture.
Research links tighter blood-sugar control to roughly halving heart-disease risk, strengthening the economic case for prevention and diabetes-management therapies.
